description: Responsible AI practices and ethical considerations

scenarios.title: Bias Detection and Mitigation
scenarios.description: Learn to identify and address bias in AI systems

scenario.context: Your AI hiring system shows preference for certain demographic groups.
scenario.challenge: What's the best approach to address this bias?

options.text: Ignore the bias since the AI is technically working
options.feedback: Ignoring bias perpetuates discrimination and is ethically wrong.

options.text: Audit the training data, adjust algorithms, and implement bias monitoring
options.feedback: Excellent! This is a comprehensive approach to bias mitigation.

options.text: Simply remove demographic information from inputs
options.feedback: This doesn't address underlying bias and may create proxy discrimination.

scenarios.title: Privacy and Data Protection
scenarios.description: Understand privacy principles in AI development

scenario.context: You're building an AI health monitoring app that collects personal health data.
scenario.challenge: How do you ensure user privacy while maintaining AI effectiveness?

options.text: Collect all available data for better AI performance
options.feedback: This violates privacy principles and data minimization practices.

options.text: Implement data minimization, encryption, and user consent protocols
options.feedback: Perfect! This balances AI effectiveness with privacy protection.

options.text: Share data with third parties for better insights
options.feedback: This compromises user privacy without proper consent and safeguards.

scenarios.title: Transparency and Explainability
scenarios.description: Learn the importance of making AI decisions understandable

scenario.context: Your AI system denies a loan application, but the applicant wants to know why.
scenario.challenge: How do you provide meaningful explanation for the AI's decision?

options.text: Tell them it's proprietary and can't be explained
options.feedback: This lacks transparency and may violate regulatory requirements.

options.text: Provide clear, understandable explanations of key factors that influenced the decision
options.feedback: Excellent! This promotes transparency and builds trust.

options.text: Give a generic response about credit scoring
options.feedback: This doesn't provide meaningful explanation specific to their case.

scenarios.title: Fairness and Justice
scenarios.description: Ensure AI systems promote fairness across different groups

scenario.context: Your AI system for university admissions shows different acceptance rates for different ethnic groups.
scenario.challenge: How do you address this fairness concern?

options.text: Accept the results since the AI is objective
options.feedback: AI systems can perpetuate historical biases and aren't automatically fair.

options.text: Analyze root causes, adjust for historical inequities, and implement fairness metrics
options.feedback: Great! This addresses systemic issues and promotes equitable outcomes.

options.text: Apply the same algorithm to everyone equally
options.feedback: Equal treatment doesn't always result in fair outcomes due to historical disadvantages.

scenarios.title: Accountability and Responsibility
scenarios.description: Establish clear responsibility frameworks for AI decisions

scenario.context: An autonomous AI system makes a decision that causes significant harm.
scenario.challenge: How do you establish accountability for this outcome?

options.text: Blame the AI system itself since it made the decision
options.feedback: AI systems aren't moral agents; human responsibility must be established.

options.text: Establish clear governance structures with defined human responsibility at each level
options.feedback: Excellent! This ensures human accountability throughout the AI lifecycle.

options.text: Consider it an unavoidable consequence of AI advancement
options.feedback: This avoids responsibility and doesn't promote ethical AI development.
